original: Methanol, a type of alcohol derived primarily from fossil fuels, is often less expensive than ethanol and can be blended with gasoline in a manner similar to ethanol. In 2007, China blended over 1 billion US gallons (approximately 3.8 million cubic meters) of methanol into its fuel supply and announced plans to implement a methanol fuel standard by mid-2008.
